decision_conditions: This permission shall be for a temporary period only expiring 24 months from the date of this permission on or before which date this use shall cease and the seating area/platform and barrier removed fully from the site, and the land restored to its previous condition.

Reason: To enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the development in the interests of visual amenity in accordance with the provisions of Policy DC61 of the London Borough of Havering's LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy 2008.
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans, particulars and specifications.

Reason:- The Local Planning Authority consider it essential that the whole of the development is carried out and that no departure whatsoever is made from the details approved, since the development would not necessarily be acceptable if partly carried out or carried out differently in any degree from the details submitted.  Also, in order that the development accords with the provisions of Policy DC61 of the London Borough of Havering's LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy 2008.
The external siting of the seating hereby approved shall take place only within the area as shown on the drawing 17091 Rev A.

Reason: In order to contain potential obstruction of the pavements in the interests of pedestrian safety and in the interests of highway safety in accordance with the provisions of Policy DC61 of the London Borough of Havering's LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy 2008..

The seating area shall not be used for the purposes hereby permitted other than between the hours of 12pm till 11pm on Monday to Friday, 12pm till 12am on Saturdays and 12pm till 11pm on Sundays.  Outside of these times, the external tables and seating hereby approved shall be removed from the seating area and stored internally within the premises until the following day.

Reason: To enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control in the interests of amenity, and in order that the development accords with Policy DC61 of the London Borough of Havering's LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy 2008.
No music or speech shall be played and no sound reproduction equipment shall be placed in the outside seating area.

Reason:- To prevent noise nuisance to adjoining properties in accordance with Policy DC61 of the London Borough of Havering's LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy 2008.

Statement Required by Article 35(2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management) Order 2015: No significant problems were identified during the consideration of the application, and therefore it has been determined in accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2018.
description: Temporary permission for seating on forecourt including retrospective application for existing wooden structure within highways
